item.title: The Center add a quote by Mario Vargas Llosa
item.description: "No matter how ephemeral it is, a novel is something, while despair is nothing." -- Mario Vargas Llosa

item.title: The Center add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Of all the inanimate objects, of all men's creations, books are the nearest to us for they contain our very thoughts, our ambitions, our indignations, our illusions, our fidelity to the truth, and our persistent leanings to error. But most of all they resemble us in their precious hold on life." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: The Center add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "Art is never the voice of a country, it is an even more precious thing, the voice of the individual, doing its best to speak, not comfort of any sort, but truth. And the art that speaks it most unmistakably, most directly, most variously, most fully, is fiction." -- Eudora Welty
